body: For this to work properly, we need to know for each test to which `<testsuite>` it belongs. Otherwise we cannot skip loading bootstrap scripts that are not required when, for instance, `--filter` or `--group` are used.

issue.title: Update use of deprecated / internal phpunit classes

milestone.description: 4.5.0 can introduce new features and deprecations to be removed in 5.x. 4.5.0 will receive feature backports from 5.x where the core team or community think they will help future upgrade paths or don't rely on breaking changes. Community contributions are always welcome.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
- [x] `FixtureInjector` implements `PHPUnit\Framework\TestListener` which has been deprecated as of phpunit 8. The alternative is to use [Hook Interfaces](https://phpunit.readthedocs.io/en/8.3/extending-phpunit.html#extending-the-testrunner).

- [ ] `PHPUnit\Framework\TestSuite` extended by `Cake\TestSuite\Testsuite` is marked as internal.

- [ ] `PHPUnit\Framework\AssertionFailedError` used in various constraint classes is marked as internal.

body: Would multiple bootstrap scripts mean the tests in the directory are iterated over once per bootstrap?

issue.title: Allow TestSuite Specific Bootstraps

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

issue.body:
This PR attempts to implement #3795 

Tests have been created to verify that the configuration parses as expected, and that bootstraps are loaded both in a standard flow, as well as in process isolation.

body:
Is this still planned to be implemented? I'm actually just now running into this "issue" where it would be most ideal to have different bootstraps (unit tests don't need a db migrate/seed but the feature tests do).

Thanks!
Same here : for example, it is required for Smoke test to have a little bit of data, and nothing else fancy, so a dedicated bootstrap could be great to achieve that.

Hi.

Is there any way inside bootstrap to know which test suite is running?
Excluding hacks like `$GLOBALS['argv']`

issue.title: refactor: Split autoload for each example

repository.name: pact-php
repository.description: PHP version of Pact. Enables consumer driven contract testing, providing a mock service and DSL for the consumer project, and interaction playback and verification for the service provider project

issue.body:
Maintain a giant list of autoload items in single file for every examples is not ideal. We need to change this file everytime we add new example.

This PR move autoload items into each example. Now it can load only few required items when needed.

body: Is this still going to be implemented?

> For this to work properly, we need to know for each test to which `<testsuite>` it belongs. Otherwise we cannot skip loading bootstrap scripts that are not required when, for instance, `--filter` or `--group` are used.

To create a minimum viable solution, we can ignore `--filter`, `--group`, etc. and load all bootstrap scripts by default. We would only load testsuite-specific bootstrap scripts conditionally if either`--testsuite` or `--exclude-testsuite` were used.

rename.to: Bootstrap scripts specific to test suites
